pageContext.claim: “[The border crisis] goes into Iowa and Idaho and New Hampshire and -- you know, it's not the border, it's the border and then they come in and you end up in places that you would never think of -- of the kind of crime that we see. And it comes right through this border. It starts right here.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is right that not all undocumented migrants settle along the border. But according to 2016 estimates, they primarily live in 20 different metropolitan areas — none of which are in Iowa or Idaho. Plus, most independent research contradicts the idea that illegal immigrants bring more crime.
